steps.title: How to name your site
steps.content: Let's add a personal touch to your new site.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to 'Global'
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content tree, click on the 'Global' node.

steps.title: Open 'Global > Settings'
steps.content: From the grid on the right-hand side, choose 'Settings'.

steps.title: Go to the 'General' tab
steps.content:
Locate the field next to 'Website name' — enter your website name here.

For example, ABC Website Company.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content:
Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'.

Your updates are now live on your site! :-)

steps.title: How to view your site
steps.content: Let's preview what users will see when they visit your website.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to the 'Home' page
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content node tree, click on the 'Home' page.

steps.title: Click on the 'Info' content app
steps.content: In the top right corner, locate 'Info'. Click on this to view detailed information about this node, including, a link to view it on the frontend.

steps.title: Click on the 'Link' provided
steps.content: Under 'Links' click one of the hyperlinks provided to view your site.

name: Design your site with the 'Visual Designer'

steps.title: How to design in preview mode
steps.content: Redesign your site with the 'Visual Designer'.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to the 'Home' page
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content node tree, click on the 'Home' page.

steps.title: Click on the 'Save and preview'
steps.content:
In the bottom right corner, locate 'Save and preview'.

Click on this to access the uSkinned 'Visual Designer' and use the toggles on the right hand side to make design changes! :-)

steps.title: How to edit your 'Home' page
steps.content: Let's edit some of the content on your 'Home' page.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Home' node
steps.content: On the left-hand side, locate the 'Home' node in the content tree. Click on the 'Home' page to open and start editing.

steps.title: Edit a component in 'Main Content'
steps.content:
All pages are made up of components. You can find the component builder next to 'Main Content'.

Take some time to add, edit and reorder content.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content:
Once you're happy with everything, in the bottom-right corner click 'Save and Publish'.

Your updates are now live on your site! :-)

steps.title: How to add your first 'Page'
steps.content: Let's add your first new 'Page' to your site.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Locate the parent of your new page
steps.content:
In this example, the parent will be the 'Home' page, however, you can create a page under any other page in the content tree.

When you hover over the 'Home' page in the content tree you will see this icon '...'

steps.title: Create a new 'Page'
steps.content: From the list, choose 'Page'.

steps.title: Name your 'Page'
steps.content:
In the field at the top, enter a name for your new 'Page'.

This name will be used in the URL to access the page on the frontend of your site, however, you can override this on the page title later.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content:
Once you are happy, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'.

Your new page is now live on your site! :-)

steps.title: How to write a 'Blog post'
steps.content: Let's add your first new 'Blog Post' to your site.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Locate the 'Blog' landing page
steps.content: Expand the content tree from the 'Home' page to show all subpages in your site.

steps.title: Locate the 'Posts' folder
steps.content: When you locate the 'Blog' landing page in the content tree, expand it too.

steps.title: Create a new 'Blog Post'
steps.content: When you hover over the 'Posts' folder in the content tree you will see this icon '...'.

steps.title: Select 'Blog Post'
steps.content: From the list, choose 'Blog Post'.

steps.title: Name your 'Blog Post'
steps.content:
In the field at the top, enter a name for your new 'Blog Post'.

This name will be used in the URL to access the page on the frontend of your site, however, you can override this on the page title later.

steps.title: Set your 'Blog Post' date
steps.content:
Locate the date field next to 'Post date' — from the date picker, choose the date you wish to assign to your post.

This is a required field if you do not enter a date the post will not be displayed on your site.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content:
Once you are happy, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'.

Your new page is now live on your site! :-)

steps.title: How to edit your site 'Navigation'
steps.content: Let's get familiar with your site navigation.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to 'Global'
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content tree, click on the 'Global' node.

steps.title: Open 'Navigation'
steps.content: From the grid on the right-hand side, choose 'Navigation'.

steps.title: Your 'Navigation' options
steps.content:
There are a number of global 'Navigation' options.

You can see each option in the tabs across the top.

steps.title: Add a new 'Link'
steps.content:
A slide-out panel will appear, you can choose to link to an external or internal page, post or media item.

In the bottom-right corner, click 'Submit'

steps.title: Reorder your 'Navigation'
steps.content: Once a link is in place you can drag and drop each link to reorder.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content:
Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'.

Your updates are now live on your site! :-)

steps.title: How to add content to your 'Footer'
steps.content: Let's personalise your footer content.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to 'Global'
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content tree, click on the 'Global' node.

steps.title: Open 'Footer'
steps.content: From the grid on the right-hand side, choose 'Footer'.

steps.title: Add a 'Footer item'
steps.content:
On the 'Content' tab, locate the section called 'Footer items'.

Click on 'Add content' at the bottom of the list.

Please note, you can add, edit, reorder and delete any item in this list.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content:
Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'.

Your updates are now live on your site! :-)

steps.title: How to add your own 'Design'
steps.content: Let's start personalising the design of your site.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to 'Design'
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content tree, click on the 'Design' node.

steps.title: Available 'Designs'
steps.content: On the right-hand side, you will see a grid of all 'Designs' already created for your site. You can add as many of these as you wish.

steps.title: Create your new 'Design'
steps.content: When you hover over the 'Design' node in the content tree you will see this icon '...'.

steps.title: Create your new 'Design'
steps.content: From the list, choose 'Design'

steps.title: Name your new 'Design'
steps.content: In the field provided, enter a name for your new style.

steps.title: Choose your 'Layout' options
steps.content: Go to the 'Layout' tab and take your time to go through the options provided, including, Header & Navigation layout options.

steps.title: Upload your 'Logo and Favicon'
steps.content:
Go to the 'Logo' tab. Next to 'Website logo' click on the Media input. Choose to upload an image file from your local computer or one that is already in your Media section.

You can use .svg .png .jpg file types here.

steps.title: Add your 'Color' palette
steps.content:
Go to the 'Colors' tab and add a personal touch to the site with your own color scheme.

Please note, as a minimum, you should assign colors to each of the options provided e.g. Header, Main Navigation, Footer etc.

Below that you can then add an unlimited number of additional colors for your content and buttons.

steps.title: Choose your 'Spacing' options
steps.content: Go to the 'Spacing' tab and take your time to go through the options provided, including, padding, margins and border sizes.

steps.title: Find the perfect 'Fonts' for your design
steps.content:
Go to the 'Fonts' tab and choose from over a thousand fonts direct from Google Fonts.

You can then assign an unlimited number of 'Fonts' as well as set the sizes, line heights etc through your site design.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content: Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'.

steps.title: How to 'Upload your logo'
steps.content: Let's personalise your site with your own logo.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to 'Design'
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content tree, click on the 'Design' node.

steps.title: Choose a 'Design'
steps.content: On the right-hand side, you will see a grid of all 'Design' already created for your site. Select the 'Design' you wish to use and click on it.

steps.title: Go to the 'Logo' tab
steps.content:
Next to 'Website logo' click on the Media input. Choose to upload an image file from your local computer or one that is already in your Media section.

You can use .svg .png .jpg file types here.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content: Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'.

steps.title: How to 'Upload a favicon'
steps.content:
Let's personalise your site with a favicon.

This icon will be displayed in the browser when users visit your site. It is also used when your site is favourited.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to 'Design'
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content tree, click on the 'Design' node.

steps.title: Choose a 'Design'
steps.content: On the right-hand side, you will see a grid of all 'Design' already created for your site. Select the 'Design' you wish to use and click on it.

steps.title: Go to the 'Logo' tab
steps.content:
Next to 'Favicon' click on the Media input. Choose to upload an image file from your local computer or one that is already in your Media section.

You can use .svg .png .jpg file types here.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content: Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'.

name: Design your site with the 'Visual Designer'

steps.title: How to design in preview mode
steps.content: Redesign your site with the 'Visual Designer'.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to the 'Home' page
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content node tree, click on the 'Home' page.

steps.title: Click on the 'Save and preview'
steps.content:
In the bottom right corner, locate 'Save and preview'.

Click on this to access the uSkinned 'Visual Designer' and use the toggles on the right hand side to make design changes! :-)

steps.title: How to assign your new 'Design' to your site
steps.content: Let's add the final touches to personalising your site design by assigning your new 'Design' to your site.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to 'Global'
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content tree, click on the 'Global' node.

steps.title: Open 'Global > Settings'
steps.content: From the grid on the right-hand side, choose 'Settings'.

steps.title: Go to the 'General' tab
steps.content: Locate the title next 'Design'. Click to 'Remove' the existing design.

steps.title: Add your new 'Design'
steps.content: Click on 'Add'. In the slide-out panel, navigate to and select the 'Design' you would like to use for your site.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content:
Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'.

Your new design is now live on your site! :-)

steps.title: How to upload a file to your 'Media' section
steps.content: You can upload images, PDFs, Word Docs plus lots more files types to your 'Media' section.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Media' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Media' section.

steps.title: Create your first 'Media' item
steps.content: Hover over the 'Media' root node and click the icon '...' to the right.

steps.title: Create a new 'Image'
steps.content: From the list provided, select the 'Image' option.

steps.title: Name your 'Media' item
steps.content: In the field at the top, enter a name for your new 'Image.

steps.title: Upload your first 'Image'
steps.content: Click on the field 'Click to upload' and find an image on your local computer to upload.

steps.title: Add alternative text for your image
steps.content: This is very important for the accessibility and SEO of your website. Every image you upload you should enter a short, descriptive line.

steps.title: Save
steps.content:
Once you are happy, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save'.

Your media has now been uploaded. You can now use it anywhere on your site! :-)

steps.title: How to organise your 'Media' items into folders
steps.content: Your 'Media' can be easily organised into folders for better management.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Media' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Media' section.

steps.title: Create a new 'Folder'
steps.content: Hover over the 'Media' root node and click the icon '...'.

steps.title: Select 'Folder'
steps.content: From the list provided, select the 'Folder' option.

steps.title: Name your 'Folder'
steps.content: In the field provided, enter a short name for your folder and hit 'Save'.

steps.title: 'Save' the folder
steps.content: Once you are happy, in the bottom right of the screen, click 'Save' to create your folder.

name: Add or edit the meta title & description of any page

steps.title: How to add or edit the 'Meta Title & Description' of any page
steps.content: Let's start optimising your site for search engines like Google or Bing.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to any page in your site
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content node tree, click on any page.

steps.title: Go to the 'SEO & Share' tab
steps.content: On the right-hand side, navigate to the 'SEO & Share' tab.

steps.title: Enter your 'Title & Description'
steps.content:
In the fields provided, enter a title and description for your page.

You will see a realtime representation of what your page with look like in search engines as you type.

Please note that titles and descriptions have a recommended maximum character length, the notes below each field will indicate when you exceed that character length.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content:
Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'.

Your updates are now live on your site! :-)

And, the next time a search engine crawls your site, this content will appear in their results.

name: Hide any page from all search engines

steps.title: How to hide any page from all search engines
steps.content:
From time to time you might create a page that you don't want to be found on any search engines.

In just a few short steps you can control what search engines like Google or Bing won't see.

steps.title: Navigate to the 'Content' section
steps.content: In the top bar, locate and click on the 'Content' section.

steps.title: Go to any page in your site
steps.content: On the left-hand side, you will see the content node tree, click on any page.

steps.title: Go to the 'SEO & Share' tab
steps.content: On the right-hand side, navigate to the 'SEO & Share' tab.

steps.title: Locate the option 'Hide from search engines'
steps.content: Click on the switch provided to say 'Yes' and hide this page from search engines.

steps.title: Save and Publish
steps.content:
Once you are happy with the changes, in the bottom right of the screen, hit 'Save and Publish'.

Your updates are now live on your site! :-)
